content.raw: Version 1.3.0 is in the build queue.
Are we planning to make a new `ign-transport1` release soon? It would be nice to have this fix
content.html: Are we planning to make a new ign-transport1 release soon? It would be nice to have this fix

update.description:
See [issue #1976](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo/issues/1976/) from the Gazebo issue tracker.

Similar to what we did in pull request #139 but in this case without rearranging any member variables for preserving ABI compatibility in version 1.x.

CI results:

* [Trusty](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/main/view/ignition/job/ignition_transport-ci-pr_any-trusty-amd64/143/) :large_blue_circle: 
* [Homebrew](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/main/view/ignition/job/ignition_transport-ci-pr_any-homebrew-amd64/148/) :large_blue_circle: 
* [Windows](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/main/view/ignition/job/ignition_transport-ci-pr_any-windows7-amd64/282/) :large_blue_circle: 
* [ABI checker](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/main/view/ignition/job/ignition_transport-abichecker-any_to_any-xenial-amd64/11/) :large_blue_circle:
update.title: Fix Gazebo issue 1976

content.html: I think the comment is still valid. It's there to avoid calling delete this->context on Windows if I remember correctly.

content.raw: I'm running the `UNIT_GpsSensor_TEST` on repeat, since it only takes about 1 second. I'll run it for a while and let you know if I see any backtraces that implicate ignition transport.
